data.text: Any of various ovens for hardening, burning, or drying substances such as grain, meal, or clay, especially a brick-lined oven used to bake or fire ceramics.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: To process in one of these ovens.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: To dry or burn in a kiln.
A furnace or oven for drying, baking, or burning.
A large stove or oven; a furnace of brick or stone, or a heated chamber, for the purpose of hardening, burning, or drying anything
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.
examples: a <ex>kiln</ex> for baking or hardening earthen vessels; a <ex>kiln</ex> for drying grain, meal, lumber, etc.; a <ex>kiln</ex> for calcining limestone.

data.text: A furnace for burning bricks; a brickkiln.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.

data.text: An <xref>oven</xref> or <xref>furnace</xref> or a heated chamber, for the purpose of <xref>hardening</xref>, burning, <xref>calcining</xref> or drying anything; for example, <xref>firing</xref> <xref>ceramics</xref>, <xref>curing</xref> or preserving <xref>tobacco</xref>, or <xref>smelting</xref> <xref>ores</xref>.
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.
from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: a furnace for firing or burning or drying such things as porcelain or bricks
data.attributionText: from WordNet 3.0 Copyright 2006 by Princeton University. All rights reserved.
